result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant RYAN M MELCHER in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases 11CT27, 11CT396, 11CF246, 12CF37, 12CF340, 12CF392, 12CF460, 14CF459, 14CF260, 14CF401, 11TR4905, 12TR5300.

Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of:

12CF340: Count 4: No Contest

Court questions Defendant regarding pleas.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty.

Plea hearing on April 21, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant RYAN M MELCHER in court with attorney John H. Wallace. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Ryan W. Drengler in court.

9:19 am. Court calls case.
Cases heard today are: 11CF246, 11CT27, 11CT396, 11CT397, 11TR4905, 12CF37, 12CF340, 12CF392, 12CF460, 14CF260, 14CF401, 14CF459

Atty Knaapen states appearances.
Court indicates that the defendant has Atty Wallace in some cases and Atty Drengler in other cases as attorneys of record. 
Atty Knaapen makes statements.
Atty Drengler indicates that the defendant needs more time so that he can get treatment started. Defendant has had issues with health insurance coverage.
Court questions if the State has any objection.
Atty Knaapen makes statements.  
Atty Wallace represents the defendant on 12CF340 & 14CF401. Status conference on April 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on March 2, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Status conference on April 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on March 2, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Pre-trial conference on January 20, 2015 at 10:30 am.
for Documents and Motion for Discovery & Motion for Discovery and Demand for Discovery
Pre-trial conference on January 12, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Ryan M. Melcher in court with attorney John H. Wallace. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions Attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.

Bond Continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 12, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on November 10, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on November 10, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Ryan M. Melcher in court with attorney Ryan W. Drengler. Cass Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  
Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.

NOT GUILTY plea entered.

BY THE COURT:  Bond Continued.

ADA Knaapen appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.

1:18 PM Court calls case.
Court states appearances.

ADA  Knaapen states facts for anticipated charges of Felony Bailjumping.
Court addresses right to remain silent.
Defendant addresses the Court, was going to the pretrial supervision once a month, was not aware that he was to go more often. Defendant did not have anyone telling him that he was to go more often. Defendant hasn't been able to get in touch with his attorney, this is not right.

Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.

Court questions Defendant. 
State requests a cash bond of $500 with conditions as stated.
Defendant requests a partial signature with a $250 cash. Defendant did not fail his UA, only missed one month and did not do that on purpose.

Initial Appearance Scheduled for: October 27, 2014   @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch 1

Court advises Defendant to contact Atty Drengler.

Comply with conditions of bond in all other cases.  Participate in the Portage County Pre-Trial Supervision Program and comply with the requirements for reporting, assessment, and programming. Report to this program today (10-22-14) to get reaquainted with schedule.
